title: Benjamin Watkins Leigh
description: Benjamin Watkins Leigh (1781-1849) was appointed to an empty Senatorial seat from Virginia in 1834. During the hysteria over Abolitionist publications in 1835, he famously said that Virginians had the right “to suppress to the utmost of our power what we deem inflammatory, dangerous, mischievous."
